content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    blocks = split(md, "```julia")
    # If there is only one block, it's the whole document without code fences
    if length(blocks) == 1
        return blocks[1]
    end
    # Remove the empty first element and concatenate all other elements
    code_content = join([split(b, "\n") for b in blocks[2:end]], "\n")
    # Return the joined string of code without the surrounding fences 
    return code_content
end
```
Please note that this function assumes that the input `md` is a valid markdown document. This means it expects that all code blocks start with "```julia" and end with "\n```". If there are any other situations or edge cases, you might need to add more checks/exception handling.
